Title: The New Housekeeper
Summary: Sheriff Andy Taylor invites Aunt Bee to stay and help raise his 6-year-old son Opie when his housekeeper, Rose, leaves to get married. Opie objects to the change.

Title: The Manhunt
Summary: A state police captain errs in not utilizing Sheriff Taylor's intimate knowledge of the area and its people when issuing a dragnet for an escaped criminal.

Title: The Guitar Player
Summary: Sheriff Taylor twists the law to help a musically gifted citizen leave the community nest by arresting a traveling band on trumped up charges.

Title: Ellie Comes to Town
Summary: A problem with ethics soon puts a pretty, new lady pharmacist on the town's black list over withholding a senior citizen her regular pills without a prescription.

Title: Irresistible Andy
Summary: Andy overthinks his asking Ellie to the church dance (prompted by her uncle Fred) into believing they've tricked him aboard the fast track to matrimony, for which he takes steps to derail.

Title: Runaway Kid
Summary: Andy lectures Opie on the value of keeping one's promise then later asks him to break it to reveal the identity of the runaway kid he just met and befriended, leaving Opie confused.

Title: Andy the Matchmaker
Summary: To boost his dejected deputy's confidence, Sheriff Taylor concocts a phony robbery, only to have Deputy Fife arrest a man for a crime that never happened.

Title: Opie's Charity
Summary: Pride in what other people think presents itself to Andy two-fold when he hears that Opie gave only a measly three cents to a school charity fund, and when a two-years-dead husband walks up to say hello.

Title: A Feud Is a Feud
Summary: For the sake of a determined young couple, Andy aims to end an 87-year-old bloodless feud betwixt their daddies.

Title: Ellie for Council
Summary: Ellie's run for city council divides Mayberry into a battle of the sexes.

Title: Christmas Story
Summary: Crotchety old businessman Ben Weaver wants moonshiner Sam Muggins locked up for Christmas but, after seeing the holiday spirit in Andy's jail, he tries to be arrested himself.

Title: Stranger in Town
Summary: A smiling stranger comes to Mayberry - and danged if he don't know everything about everybody, giving the townsfolk a righteous case of the willies.

Title: Mayberry Goes Hollywood
Summary: Mayberry gussies up for a Hollywood film crew - exactly what the visiting Hollywood producer and Andy don't want.

Title: The Horse Trader
Summary: Andy's admonishment to Opie about dealing fairly with others 'snafus' when he subsequently trumps up a fanciful story to sell a worthless cannon to an out-of-area antiques dealer.

Title: Those Gossipin' Men
Summary: When a shoe salesman comes to town, riled Aunt Bee uses him to teach Andy a lesson in men being just as big a bunch of gossips as women.

Title: The Beauty Contest
Summary: The town council selects Andy to judge the first beauty contest for Mayberry's Founder's Day celebration, much to Andy's utter regret.

Title: Alcohol and Old Lace
Summary: In tracking down area moonshiners, Barney and Andy hardly suspect the little, old Morrison sisters who've been so helpful to them, but they should.

Title: Andy the Marriage Counselor
Summary: Nice as they can be to others, Fred and Jennie Boone snap at each other violently at home. Andy intervenes on behalf of the general peace but learns that others can express their happiness differently.

Title: Mayberry on Record
Summary: Andy suspects that Barney and a few other citizens have been taken in by a slick music-recording man from out of town.

Title: Andy Saves Barney's Morale
Summary: Barney becomes a laughing stock after being left in charge and arresting upstanding townsfolk over petty violations. Andy must step in and make them appreciate Barney before he quits.

Title: Andy and the Gentleman Crook
Summary: The infamous con man 'Gentleman' Dan Caldwell beguiles nearly everyone from his cell at Andy's jail - all but Andy.

Title: Cyrano Andy
Summary: With Barney tongue-tied around potential sweetheart Thelma Lou, Andy sticks his big nose in on their behalf only to find himself and Ellie pulled into romantic duplicities.

Title: Andy and Opie, Housekeepers
Summary: Taylor men are slobs, but picking up after themselves when on their own may be the wrong message to send to Aunt Bee, who needs to feel needed.

Title: The New Doctor
Summary: Barney and Aunt Bee get Andy worked up over the idea of Ellie dumping him to tie the knot with the new, young, handsome, unmarried doctor in town.

Title: A Plaque for Mayberry
Summary: That there may be a direct descendant of a Revolutionary War hero living in Mayberry flatters the town, 'til they learn who it is.

Title: The Inspector
Summary: A new state inspector pays the annual call on Andy's jail only to spot multiple reasons for having Andy impeached and Barney dismissed.

Title: Ellie Saves a Female
Summary: Ellie crosses the line when she insists on a farm girl wearing make-up and perfume against her hard-pressed father's wishes, leading Barney to commit an abduction.

Title: Andy Forecloses
Summary: When the Scobey family misses a mortgage payment, Ben Weaver insists Andy serve them a foreclosure notice immediately, but Andy aims to save the Scobeys their home.

Title: Quiet Sam
Summary: Barney grows increasingly wary of a reticent new farmer in town, calling up a posse during a thunderstorm when it seems Andy has walked straight into the man's nefarious trap.

Title: Barney Gets His Man
Summary: The accidental capture of a wanted man makes Barney the toast of Mayberry. It goes to his head 'til the felon escapes and returns to pay Barney back.

Title: The Guitar Player Returns
Summary: Mayberry's own guitar celebrity Jim Lindsey returns, but he's not the conquering musical hero everyone thinks he is.

Title: Bringing Up Opie
Summary: After he handcuffs a classmate to a flagpole, Aunt Bee insists the jail is no place for Opie to hang out, but denying him contact with his pa puts him at greater risk.

Title: Opie and the Bully
Summary: Andy, through Barney, learns that Opie has been targeted by a bully who's been shaking him down for milk money, leaving Andy to wonder how to intervene without letting Opie know he knows.

Title: Barney's Replacement
Summary: When the State Attorney's Office sends Andy a man to give practical lawman experience to, Barney believes Andy wants him to train a 'replacement' deputy.

Title: Andy and the Woman Speeder
Summary: An out-of-town speeder thinks Andy runs a speed trap in Mayberry. Awaiting her day in court gives her plenty of time to work on swaying the witnesses - Barney, Floyd and Opie.

Title: Mayberry Goes Bankrupt
Summary: The callous eviction of a down-on-his-luck elder citizen comes back to bite the town council when the man's uncashed municipal bond amounts to more than the town can pay.

Title: Barney on the Rebound
Summary: A flashy, sophisticated new girl in town takes a surprising and deep interest in Barney.

Title: Opie's Hobo Friend
Summary: Andy must put away the welcome mat when a likable drifter, passing through Mayberry, starts putting Artful Dodger-ish notions into Opie's head.

Title: Crime-Free Mayberry
Summary: All but Andy get excited over Mayberry's distinction at being named the most crime-free town in America, unaware they're being targeted by criminals while honoring their lawmen.

Title: The Perfect Female
Summary: Barney and Thelma Lou successfully match-make Andy and Thelma Lou's cousin Karen, but Barney's unfortunate way of describing the situation has Karen rifle-ready to shoot down Andy's supposed inflated ego.

Title: Aunt Bee's Brief Encounter
Summary: Handyman Henry Wheeler enters the Taylors' life, for whom Aunt Bee develops a wistful soft spot. For her sake, Andy keeps him on with chores but progressively discovers Henry's true vocation - that of a freeloader.

Title: The Clubmen
Summary: When Andy and Barney have a chance to join an exclusive men's club, Andy wonders how to break it to sensitive Barney when he learns they only want Andy.

Title: The Pickle Story
Summary: No one will admit to Aunt Bee's homemade pickles being the worst they've ever tasted. Andy switches them with store-bought ones to avoid eating hers, but her decision to enter them in the county fair presents a dilemma.

Title: Sheriff Barney
Summary: When Barney is offered the job of sheriff in a nearby town, he and Andy trade jobs for a day to see what kind of sheriff he would be.

Title: The Farmer Takes a Wife
Summary: Local farmer 'Big' Jeff Pruitt comes to town to pick a wife. Unfortunately for Barney, he chooses Thelma Lou.

Title: The Keeper of the Flame
Summary: Opie joins a secret club and is in charge of the candle they use in their meetings. After the barn where they meet burns down, he is accused by the owner of starting the fire.

Title: Bailey's Bad Boy
Summary: Andy teaches self-reliance and responsibility to the spoiled son of a rich man.

Title: The Manicurist
Summary: When a pretty young manicurist starts working in Floyd's Barber Shop, the men are uneasy about it at first but eventually take to the idea in a big way. Their jealous wives, however, do not.

Title: The Jinx
Summary: A bad move at checkers prompts Barney to label townsman Henry Bennett a jinx for looking over his shoulder. Andy sets about to rectify this bad rep before it forces the dejected man to leave Mayberry.

Title: Jailbreak
Summary: The state police come to town to catch some payroll robbers. They want Andy and Barney to stay out of the way and let them handle it. The big boys end up needing Andy and Barney more than they thought.

Title: A Medal for Opie
Summary: Opie signs up for a race to win a medal but learns a lesson in good sportsmanship instead.

Title: Barney and the Choir
Summary: The choir director invites Barney to join the choir before he realizes Barney can't sing.

Title: Guest of Honor
Summary: The town decides to celebrate Founder's Day by picking a stranger at random to be the town's 'Guest of Honor.' Unfortunately the person they choose turns out to be a thief who's just been kicked out of the neighboring county.

Title: The Merchant of Mayberry
Summary: Andy helps a struggling salesman stay in town.

Title: Aunt Bee the Warden
Summary: With the jail full of angry moonshiners, Otis serves his latest public intoxication sentence at the Taylor residence under the stern and watchful eye of Aunt Bee.

Title: The County Nurse
Summary: When local farmer Rafe Hollister refuses to take his tetanus shot, Andy and Barney try to convince him he should.

Title: Andy and Barney in the Big City
Summary: Andy and Barney travel to Raleigh on business and help catch a jewel thief in their hotel.

Title: Wedding Bells for Aunt Bee
Summary: Clara convinces Aunt Bee that her presence is keeping Andy from finding a wife. When Mr. Goss shows interest in her, she pretends to be interested in him and nearly ends up married.

Title: Three's a Crowd
Summary: Barney interferes with Andy's new romance.

Title: The Bookie Barber
Summary: When business gets too hectic, Floyd hires a second barber who turns out to be a bookie. Barney goes undercover as an old lady to catch them.

Title: Andy on Trial
Summary: Andy is accused of official misconduct by a big-shot newspaper publisher whom he officially summoned on a traffic violation.

Title: Cousin Virgil
Summary: Barney's awkward cousin visits and makes a mess of everything he tries. When Andy finds something that Virgil is good at, he finds a way to teach him self-confidence.

Title: Deputy Otis
Summary: Otis is made a temporary deputy so he can impress his visiting older brother.

Title: Mr. McBeevee
Summary: Opie starts talking about his new friend Mr. McBeevee, but his description is hard to believe.

Title: Andy's Rich Girlfriend
Summary: When Andy finds out his new girlfriend's father is wealthy, Barney talks him into believing the relationship is doomed.

Title: Andy and the New Mayor
Summary: Mayberry's new mayor doesn't like Andy or the way he does his job.

Title: Andy and Opie - Bachelors
Summary: Aunt Bee heads out of town for a few days, leaving Andy and Opie to take care of themselves. When Peggy volunteers to cook for them, Floyd tries to convince Andy that she's trying to catch a husband.

Title: The Cow Thief
Summary: The mayor calls in an investigator from the state capital to help solve a string of cow thefts.

Title: Barney Mends a Broken Heart
Summary: After Andy has an argument with Peggy, Barney tries to make things better by setting him up with another girl.

Title: Lawman Barney
Summary: Two intimidating farmers test Barney's effectiveness as a lawman when they scare him off after refusing to obey his directive to stop illegally selling produce roadside.

Title: The Mayberry Band
Summary: Mayberry's town band is the worst in the state and Mayor Stoner refuses to allow them to go to the state capital to play. It looks like they will have to stay home until Andy gets a little help from Freddy Fleet and his band.

Title: Floyd, the Gay Deceiver
Summary: In pen-pal correspondences with a wealthy widow, Floyd has presented himself as equally well off. Her sudden decision to visit Mayberry leaves him in a tizzy and begging for Andy's help in maintaining the ruse.

Title: Opie's Rival
Summary: Andy's new girlfriend is the new county nurse. Everyone likes her except Opie, who is jealous of all the time Andy spends with her.

Title: Convicts-at-Large
Summary: Barney and Floyd are held hostage in a cabin by three escaped women convicts.

Title: The Bed Jacket
Summary: After making Andy promise to get nothing fancy for her birthday, an adorable bed jacket strikes Aunt Bee's fancy. Now if only she can undo Andy's promise.

Title: The Bank Job
Summary: Barney thinks the Mayberry Bank is a pushover for a robbery and sets out to prove it.

Title: One-Punch Opie
Summary: Opie must learn to fight when a new boy in town ridicules him and begins to lead his friends towards a life of crime.

Title: Barney and the Governor
Summary: After Barney tickets the governor's car for illegal parking, the governor, impressed, comes to Mayberry to congratulate him for doing a good job. Barney, not realizing this, thinks he is going to lose his job instead.

Title: Man in a Hurry
Summary: Car trouble strands a busy businessman in Mayberry on a Sunday, where the slow pace registers more as an infuriating dead stop.

Title: High Noon in Mayberry
Summary: A hard, wounded man with gun in hand comes to Mayberry looking for Andy. Barney, aiming to keep their sheriff alive, deputizes Otis and Gomer.

Title: The Loaded Goat
Summary: What do you do with a goat full of dynamite? Nobody in Mayberry seems to know, least of all Otis, who shows up even more 'loaded' than the goat.

Title: Class Reunion
Summary: At his high school class reunion, Andy finds that, while memories may fade over time, some connections are never completely broken, and some hearts never completely heal.

Title: Rafe Hollister Sings
Summary: When image-conscious Mayor Stoner objects to a golden-voiced--but wardrobe-challenged--farmer chosen to represent Mayberry in the upcoming musicale, Andy must find a way to appease all sides.

Title: Opie and the Spoiled Kid
Summary: Opie's friend Arnold seems to have it all--a new bike, fat allowance, and plenty of leisure time. When the pressure's on, though, Opie learns that these assets are actually Arnold's greatest weakness.

Title: The Great Filling Station Robbery
Summary: After a series of auto-related thefts, the shadow of suspicion looms ever longer over Jimmy--a youth with a troubled past. How long can Andy rush to Jimmy's defense before his own faith in the boy is shaken?

Title: Andy Discovers America
Summary: Opie's reinterpretation of Andy's encouragement lands Andy in hot water with Opie's new teacher, Miss Helen 'Old Lady' Crump.

Title: Aunt Bee's Medicine Man
Summary: Andy must protect Aunt Bee from a charming traveling dishonest huckster whose 170-proof 'tonic' provides temporary relief from mid-life crisis.

Title: The Darlings Are Coming
Summary: The Darlings, a musical mountain family, descend upon Mayberry.

Title: Andy's English Valet
Summary: When cultures clash, cars crash, and Andy's home becomes his castle as he engages the employment of a bicycle-touring Englishman who must work off an unfortunately-earned debt.

Title: Barney's First Car
Summary: It's a red-letter day in Mayberry when Barney decides to join the motoring world, but things go sour when his cream-puff turns out to be a lemon.

Title: The Rivals
Summary: When Opie's efforts fail to attract classmate Karen's personal interest, Thelma Lou steps in to boost Opie's confidence but destroys Barney's along the way. Can Andy realign this skewed love quadrangle?

Title: A Wife for Andy
Summary: Barney's ready for Andy to get married, but Andy is not. In the situations that follow, Andy may have found someone, unbeknownst to Mayberry's most meddlesome matchmaker.

Title: Dogs, Dogs, Dogs
Summary: It's pandemonium when eleven stray dogs invade the courthouse. The boys have do find out what to do with them before a state investigator arrives to do an audit.

Title: Mountain Wedding
Summary: The Darlings ask Andy to help them deal with wild mountain man Ernest T. Bass, who wants the already-married Charlene Darling/Wash for himself.

Title: The Big House
Summary: When the Mayberry jail is called upon to lodge two hold-up men captured by the state police, Barney finds himself with more than he can handle - especially when 'assisted' by ad-hoc deputy Gomer.

Title: Opie the Birdman
Summary: After Opie accidentally kills a mother bird with his new slingshot, he takes on the job of raising her babies himself. He grows very attached to them, but then has to set them free when they get big.

Title: The Haunted House
Summary: Barney and Gomer try to retrieve a baseball from a supposedly haunted house and find some strange goings on inside.

Title: Ernest T. Bass Joins the Army
Summary: Ernest T. Bass causes a ruckus when he decides to join the army. When Andy and Barney find out why, they are able to solve his problem - with a little help from Barney.

Title: The Sermon for Today
Summary: A visiting preacher tells the town to relax and enjoy the simple pleasures of life. He inspires everyone to have an old-time band concert. With all the stress of rebuilding the broken-down bandstand and getting ragged uniforms ready, they wear themselves out.

Title: Briscoe Declares for Aunt Bee
Summary: After being treated to Aunt Bee's hospitality and home cooking, Briscoe Darling decides he is going to marry her. He even resorts to kidnapping her. Andy comes up with a clever solution to the whole mess.

Title: Gomer the House Guest
Summary: After Gomer gets fired from the filling station (losing his room there), he moves in with Andy. When people come by the house at all hours of the night to get their cars looked at, Andy knows he has to do something.

Title: A Black Day for Mayberry
Summary: Andy and Barney have to protect a shipment of gold which will be going through Mayberry on the way to Fort Knox. It's critical that they keep it a secret, but Barney spills the beans immediately and within minutes all of Mayberry knows. A carnival-like atmosphere soon takes hold. The plot thickens when Barney discovers there's no gold in the truck.

Title: Opie's Ill-Gotten Gain
Summary: A mistake by Opie's teacher causes him to get all A's on his report card. He finds out the truth, but everyone is so proud of him (he even receives a new bike) he can't figure out how to break the news without disappointing them all.

Title: Up in Barney's Room
Summary: Barney's landlady evicts him and he has to move into the back room of the courthouse. When she withdraws all her money and decides to marry someone she just met, Barney suspects she is the victim of a con man.

Title: A Date for Gomer
Summary: Barney has to play matchmaker for Thelma Lou's homely, visiting cousin Mary Grace, and sets her up with Gomer Pyle.

Title: Citizen's Arrest
Summary: Gomer makes a citizen's arrest of Barney for committing the same traffic violation that Barney just ticketed him for. This causes Barney to overreact, resigning as deputy and demanding a jail sentence in lieu of paying the fine. When Gomer finds out how far it has gone, he tries to come up with a solution.

Title: Opie and His Merry Men
Summary: After watching a movie about Robin Hood, Opie and his pals befriend a hobo who encourages them to steal from those who have and give to him.

Title: Barney and the Cave Rescue
Summary: After Andy and Helen go exploring in a cave, it collapses behind them. They find another way out, but hear on the radio that Barney has mobilized the town to rescue them. They go back into the cave to save Barney from becoming a laughingstock.

Title: Andy and Opie's Pal
Summary: Opie's new friend Trey is liked by everyone, but Opie becomes jealous when he thinks Andy likes Trey more than him.

Title: Aunt Bee the Crusader
Summary: Aunt Bee organizes a crusade to keep a local man from being evicted because of a highway project. She doesn't realize he has something to hide.

Title: Barney's Sidecar
Summary: Barney buys an old surplus army motorcycle and sidecar to use on patrol, then becomes a menace to the whole town.

Title: My Fair Ernest T. Bass
Summary: In order to help Ernest T. Bass find a girl, Andy and Barney attempt to teach him some manners and get him dressed up. Then they try to pass him off at a party as Andy's cousin from Raleigh.

Title: Prisoner of Love
Summary: A beautiful young prisoner manages to charm both Barney and Andy.

Title: Hot Rod Otis
Summary: Otis has Andy and Barney worried when he buys a car.

Title: The Song Festers
Summary: Barney is the only tenor in the choir. When a tenor solo part is required the choir director is desperate to find someone else to sing the part. Gomer becomes the replacement

Title: The Shoplifters
Summary: Ben Weaver complains to the Mayberry sheriff's office that merchandise has been disappearing from his department store. While Andy investigates, Barney decides to go undercover to catch the crook(s).

Title: Andy's Vacation
Summary: Andy takes a much-needed vacation, leaving Barney and Gomer in charge. Unfortunately, nobody will let him get any rest.

Title: Andy Saves Gomer
Summary: After Andy wakes up Gomer to put out a small fire at the filling station, Gomer dedicates himself to repaying Andy in return for saving his life.

Title: Bargain Day
Summary: To save money, Aunt Bee buys a side of beef from a discount butcher shop. When she gets it home, the freezer doesn't work right but she won't pay 'the man' from Mount Pilot to come and fix it.

Title: Divorce, Mountain Style
Summary: Charlene Darling uses a mountain ritual to divorce Dud Wash and marry Andy.

Title: A Deal Is a Deal
Summary: Opie and his friends get involved in a scheme selling a worthless product called 'Miracle Salve'.

Title: Fun Girls
Summary: Two fun-loving girls from Mount Pilot interrupt Andy and Barney's late-night office work. When Helen and Thelma Lou see them together, they get upset and cancel their dates to the big dance. Barney decides he and Andy will take the fun girls instead.

Title: The Return of Malcolm Merriweather
Summary: When Malcolm Merriweather returns to Mayberry, Andy hires him to help Aunt Bee with the housework so she can be a 'lady of leisure'. She goes from being overworked to feeling unneeded.

Title: The Rumor
Summary: Barney sees Andy and Helen in the jewelry store sneaking a kiss and tells everyone they are engaged. Aunt Bee redecorates Andy's room for a bride and throws a big surprise party for them.

Title: Barney and Thelma Lou, Phfftt
Summary: After Gomer mentions to Thelma Lou that Barney said he 'has her in his hip pocket', she gets angry and starts dating Gomer.

Title: Back to Nature
Summary: Andy, Barney, and Gomer take Opie and his friends camping. Barney, who said he was a great woodsman, manages to get lost in the woods with Gomer.

Title: Gomer Pyle, U.S.M.C.
Summary: Gomer joins the Marines to test himself as a man. Andy drives him to the base and stays around for a while to see how it works out. When he finds out the Sergeant plans to get Gomer sent home, he tries to find a way to get the Sergeant on Gomer's side.

Title: Opie Loves Helen
Summary: Opie develops a crush on a secret girlfriend, and gets advice on what kind of present to get her. When he comes up with a pair of nylon stockings, Andy intercedes, suggesting something less personal, like flowers. Later, Andy discovers that the secret girl is Opie's teacher, Helen Crump. Andy informs Opie that he doesn't appreciate him cutting in on his girl, and Opie relents.

Title: Barney's Physical
Summary: Barney has to gain weight and somehow grow taller in a week's time in order to meet new guidelines for sheriff's deputies or lose his job. Can he do it?

Title: The Family Visit
Summary: The Taylors find that a visit from relatives comes with complications.

Title: The Education of Ernest T. Bass
Summary: Ernest returns to school to win a girl's affection.

Title: Aunt Bee's Romance
Summary: An old beau of Aunt Bee's returns to court her, but he has an annoying sense of humor.

Title: Barney's Bloodhound
Summary: Barney tries to train a mutt, then wants to use him to help capture an escaped convict, despite Andy's objections.

Title: Man in the Middle
Summary: Barney and Thelma Lou have an argument. They reconcile quickly, but it leads to other arguments between Andy and Barney, Thelma Lou and Helen, Andy and Helen, and another between Barney and Thelma Lou.

Title: Barney's Uniform
Summary: When a tough guy threatens to beat up Barney if he catches him out of uniform, Barney begins to wear the uniform all the time.

Title: Opie's Fortune
Summary: Opie finds a change purse and almost gains $50.

Title: Goodbye Sheriff Taylor
Summary: Andy considers taking a job in Raleigh, and lets Barney take over as sheriff for a day to prepare him for the office.

Title: The Pageant
Summary: When Clara has to suddenly go out of town Aunt Bee gets the leading role in Mayberry's Centennial Pageant, but her acting skills aren't quite up to the task.

Title: The Darling Baby
Summary: The musical Darling family descends upon Mayberry again. This time they are looking for a husband for Charlene's new baby daughter. Things get complicated when they choose Opie and refuse to take no for an answer.

Title: Andy and Helen Have Their Day
Summary: Andy and Helen go on a picnic but are plagued by constant interruptions from Barney, Goober and others.

Title: Three Wishes for Opie
Summary: Barney buys a fortune-telling game and lets Opie try it out.

Title: Otis Sues the County
Summary: After Otis falls down in the sheriff's office, a sleazy lawyer convinces him he would be helping Andy and Barney if he were to sue the county.

Title: Barney Fife, Realtor
Summary: Barney decides to try his hand at the real estate business. He has a plan that will net him commissions on three sales. Crucial to the deal is Andy selling his house and buying another.

Title: Goober Takes a Car Apart
Summary: While Barney is on vacation in Raleigh, Andy needs to find someone to fill in as a temporary deputy. When Andy himself has to go to a sheriff safety conference for a few days, nobody is available, so he is stuck with Goober. Goober doesn't take the job seriously (still working at the filling station). It gets so bad that Goober begins to work on cars at the sheriff's office and even ends up completely dismantling a car right inside the courthouse.

Title: The Rehabilitation of Otis
Summary: Barney tries to rehabilitate Otis after he rides a cow, thinking it is a horse. Barney arrests Otis when it happens again, even using handcuffs. Otis leaves town and vows to never return.

Title: The Lucky Letter
Summary: Barney gets a chain letter that predicts bad luck it he doesn't make copies and send them to friends. To prove to Andy that he's not superstitious, he doesn't send any. A constant stream of back luck is the result. Things look bad when he has a marksmanship test coming up, which he has to pass in order to keep his job.

Title: Goober and the Art of Love
Summary: When Andy and Barney get tired of Goober tagging along on their dates, they decide to try teaching him how to act around women and then get him to ask a girl on a date. It proves to be quite a project.

Title: Barney Runs for Sheriff
Summary: Barney decides to run for sheriff when he thinks Andy is leaving Mayberry. When Andy ends up staying, Barney ends up running against him.

Title: If I Had a Quarter Million Dollars
Summary: Barney finds $250,000 from a bank heist, then goes undercover to find the robber.

Title: TV or Not TV
Summary: After Andy is profiled in a national sheriff's magazine as the 'Sheriff Without A Gun', a television production team comes to town to research a possible TV show about Mayberry's sheriff department. Andy suspects something's up when they spend a lot of time checking out the bank.

Title: Guest in the House
Summary: Helen gets jealous when a very attractive friend of the family visits the Taylor household for a few days.

Title: The Case of the Punch in the Nose
Summary: Barney finds an old police file about an assault between Floyd and Charles Foley from 19 years before. He refuses to let it go and stirs up a hornet's nest by investigating the case.

Title: Opie's Newspaper
Summary: When nobody buys Opie's newspaper, Andy and Barney encourage him to print more interesting stories. Opie solves his circulation problem by publishing all the scandalous gossip from around town.

Title: Aunt Bee's Invisible Beau
Summary: After Clara gives Aunt Bee the idea that her presence is preventing Andy and Helen from getting married, Aunt Bee names a married man as her imaginary beau.

Title: The Arrest of the Fun Girls
Summary: Two flashy girls from Mount Pilot get a speeding ticket and cause romantic complications for Andy and Barney.

Title: The Luck of Newton Monroe
Summary: A traveling salesman is plagued with bad luck.

Title: Opie Flunks Arithmetic
Summary: When Helen tells Andy Opie isn't doing too well in math, he's pretty relaxed about it. She recommends that Opie should do a bit more homework and he agrees. Barney, however, thinks Andy's attitude is completely off base. Barney starts talking about how Opie may not get into college and the like and gets Aunt Bee all worried. Soon, Andy is just as stressed and he tells Opie to buckle down and cut out the play time. Helen soon reports to him that since they last spoke of Opie, he is actually doing much worse and not only in math. Andy can't understand since he's been ...

Title: Opie and the Carnival
Summary: Opie tries to win Andy a birthday present at the carnival's shooting gallery but gets ripped off for all his money by a pair of hucksters using guns with crooked sights.

Title: Banjo-Playing Deputy
Summary: A destitute banjo player fills in for Barney.

Title: Opie's Job
Summary: Opie tries to get a job delivering groceries to pay for getting his bike fixed. He competes with another boy for it, but finds out the other boy needs the money to help his family.

Title: Andy's Rival
Summary: Andy gets jealous when a big-city teacher arrives to work with Helen and ends up spending several evenings with her.

Title: Malcolm at the Crossroads
Summary: Malcolm Merriweather returns to Mayberry, announcing that he plans to live there permanently. Andy gives him the job of school crossing guard after firing Ernest T. Bass from the job for throwing rocks at cars. Ernest T. challenges Malcolm to a fight which he accepts, even though he can't fight.

Title: Aunt Bee, the Swinger
Summary: Aunt Bee and her new beau go out on the town.

Title: The Bazaar
Summary: Andy's eager new deputy jails Aunt Bee and her friends for illegal gambling when they have a bingo game at their church bazaar.

Title: A Warning from Warren
Summary: Warren's ESP warns that a picnic will be a disaster for Andy and Helen.

Title: Off to Hollywood
Summary: A movie company is going to make film about Andy, and the Taylors take a trip to Hollywood to see the production.

Title: The Taylors in Hollywood
Summary: The Taylors arrive in Hollywood and meet the production team that is making the movie 'Sheriff Without A Gun'.

Title: The Hollywood Party
Summary: After Helen gets upset about a publicity picture of Andy and a pretty actress from the movie, Andy tries to get back at Helen by going on a date with the actress. When Helen calls to apologize, Opie tells her about the date.

Title: Aunt Bee on TV
Summary: Aunt Bee wins big on a TV quiz show.

Title: The Cannon
Summary: Warren's ignorance about cannons helps catch two thieves.

Title: A Man's Best Friend
Summary: Opie and his new friend Tommy are having fun with the new boy's miniature walkie-talkies. They listen in on conversations and the like but Tommy has a sense of humor that not everyone appreciates. When Goober adopts a stray dog, they hide one of the walkie-talkies in the animal's collar and soon the gullible mechanic thinks he has a talking dog. Goober soon makes a fool of himself and the boys think it's quite funny. Andy tries to impress upon them that humiliating people is not funny and teaches Tommy a lesson in what it feels like to be the butt of someone's ...

Title: Aunt Bee Takes a Job
Summary: Aunt Bee takes a part-time job at a printing shop that has just opened in town. When Andy notices, among other things, that they print business cards with green ink, he figures out just what they're in the business of printing!

Title: The Church Organ
Summary: When the old church organ heaves its last note, Warren finds an ad for a used one placed by a local farmer, and Andy gets pledges from local businessmen to supplement what's in the church fund to pay for it. When it's time to collect on the pledges, all Andy gets are excuses. But the farmer can't afford to budge on the price. The church organist herself, Clara, relies on her intuition to supply a solution.

Title: Girl Shy
Summary: After watching a TV show about a suave adventurer, Warren becomes like the character while sleepwalking and tries to romance Helen. When he wakes up, he doesn't remember a thing.

Title: Otis the Artist
Summary: Warren meets Otis for the first time and tries to cure his alcoholism by introducing him to mosaic art. Surprisingly, Otis takes to it well, and even stops drinking. The only problem is that he has no artistic talent.

Title: The Return of Barney Fife
Summary: Barney comes back to town for the high school reunion and meets everyone, including Thelma Lou, who has also returned to Mayberry.

Title: The Legend of Barney Fife
Summary: While Barney is back in Mayberry, a convict escapes and heads to Mayberry to get even with him for sending him to prison the year before.

Title: Lost and Found
Summary: Aunt Bee finds a lost antique pin after spending the insurance money she got for it. She feels like she has stolen from the insurance company, but Warren and Goober end up helping clear her conscience.

Title: Wyatt Earp Rides Again
Summary: A wild west show comes to town featuring a wimpy man who is said to be related to Wyatt Earp.

Title: Aunt Bee Learns to Drive
Summary: Aunt Bee takes driving lessons from Goober. Although she isn't licensed to drive by herself, she moves the car for a tree trimmer and runs it into the tree.

Title: Look Paw, I'm Dancing
Summary: Opie is really looking forward to the school party this year - that is until he learns that, for the first time, it's going to be a dance. The problem is that Opie can't dance. He quickly loses interest in the party and Andy doesn't think much of it until Floyd reminds him that the same happened to Andy when he was Opie's age. Aunt Bee's attempt to teach Opie a few steps proves to be just a bit outdated however. Opie is convinced he will just plain embarrass himself, but it turns out not to be so bad after all.

Title: The Gypsies
Summary: When a band of Gypsies comes to town and starts selling junk to people, Andy tries running them off. They put a curse on the town, saying it will not rain again until they are allowed to come back. When there is no rain for over a week, the town turns against Andy.

Title: Eat Your Heart Out
Summary: Goober falls hard for the new waitress at the diner, but she only has eyes for Andy.

Title: A Baby in the House
Summary: When Aunt Bee gets a call from her niece Martha asking if she would take take care of their baby for a week while they attend a wedding, she gladly accepts. She also assures Andy that the baby will be no trouble at all. She's somewhat taken aback however when the baby cries every time she picks her up. Others seem to have no problem, including Andy. She soon finds herself asking anyone who is handy to stop by the house at feeding times, as she's convinced herself that the baby hates her. An emergency of sorts convinces her otherwise.

Title: The County Clerk
Summary: Andy and Helen try their matchmaking skills on Howard Sprague and the pretty new county health officer, Miss Fairchild. They find out Howard's mother keeps him on a very short leash.

Title: The Foster Lady
Summary: Aunt Bee is asked to star in a commercial for Foster's Furniture Polish.

Title: Goober's Replacement
Summary: Goober's girlfriend Flora fills in for him at the gas station when he goes on a fishing trip. When Wally sees how she brings in the customers, he fires Goober and hires Flora.

Title: The Battle of Mayberry
Summary: Opie causes a stir in town when he writes a school paper on the historic Battle of Mayberry. He finds that the truth does not match the legend.

Title: A Singer in Town
Summary: A pop singer stops in town and ends up performing a song that Aunt Bee and Clara wrote on his TV show. Unfortunately, his version of the song does not meet their approval.

Title: Opie's Girlfriend
Summary: Helen's visiting niece Cynthia feigns helplessness to charm Opie, even though she is athletically superior to him.

Title: The Lodge
Summary: When Andy nominates Howard for membership in the local lodge, Howard's mother tries to prevent it by spreading a false rumor.

Title: The Barbershop Quartet
Summary: When Howard becomes unavailable to sing in a Barbershop Quartet contest, Andy reluctantly drafts a prisoner to fill in.

Title: The Ball Game
Summary: Andy is drafted to umpire a baseball game and then is shunned by the entire town when his call causes Mayberry to lose.

Title: Aunt Bee's Crowning Glory
Summary: Aunt Bee shocks the town with her new blonde wig and becomes the object of a visiting minister's attention.

Title: The Darling Fortune
Summary: The Darlings sell some land to the county for $300. Briscoe decides it's time to get his boys married off and they spend the day in town looking for brides. After they can't find anyone, they're ready to leave when they see an omen that says the next woman they see will be a bride. Then they see Helen coming down the sidewalk.

Title: Mind Over Matter
Summary: After Goober is involved in a minor traffic accident, Floyd and Aunt Bee convince him he has whiplash.

Title: Politics Begin at Home
Summary: Aunt Bee and Howard Sprague both run for the same seat on the town council.

Title: The Senior Play
Summary: Helen and her students try to close the generation gap by showing that today's kids are no different than yesterday's.

Title: Opie Finds a Baby
Summary: Opie and Arnold find an abandoned baby on the courthouse steps. Afraid that it will be sent to an orphanage, they try to find a home for it.

Title: Big Fish in a Small Town
Summary: After beginner angler Howard lands legendary carp 'Old Sam', he discovers he has spoiled fishing for everyone by catching The Big One.

Title: Only a Rose
Summary: Aunt Bee has a rose that she thinks will finally win her first place in the annual Garden Club contest until Opie accidentally destroys it.

Title: Otis, the Deputy
Summary: Otis and Howard try to rescue Andy when he is held captive by two desperate bank robbers on the run.

Title: Goober Makes History
Summary: Goober annoys everyone when he becomes convinced his new beard makes him an intellectual.

Title: A New Doctor in Town
Summary: Mayberry has a new doctor in town who runs into difficulty being accepted because no one wants to be his first patient.

Title: Don't Miss a Good Bet
Summary: A slick con man comes to town and dupes several people, including Andy.

Title: Dinner at Eight
Summary: Three friends cook three different dinners for Andy in one night.

Title: A Visit to Barney Fife
Summary: Andy takes a trip to Raleigh to visit Barney and ends up making him a hero by solving a series of robberies.

Title: Barney Comes to Mayberry
Summary: Barney visits the same time as a movie star who's also from Mayberry. When her PR man learns she and Barney dated in school, he has Barney escort her to her new movie's premiere. Unfortunately, Barney thinks he has rekindled an old romance.

Title: Andy's Old Girlfriend
Summary: Helen gets jealous when an old girlfriend of Andy's returns to Mayberry.

Title: Aunt Bee's Restaurant
Summary: Aunt Bee enters the business world when she becomes part owner of a Chinese restaurant.

Title: Floyd's Barbershop
Summary: Floyd decides to close the barbershop after Howard buys the building and raises the rent.

Title: The Statue
Summary: After the town has a statue made honoring a heroic Taylor ancestor, the find out he was a swindler.

Title: Helen, the Authoress
Summary: Andy gets jealous when a publisher buys Helen's book for children.

Title: Goodbye, Dolly
Summary: When the milkman gets a truck to do his deliveries, Opie is asked to care for his old delivery horse, Dolly. After she refuses to eat for several days, they figure out what's wrong.

Title: Opie's Piano Lesson
Summary: Opie's piano lessons clash with football practice.

Title: Howard, the Comedian
Summary: Howard does a successful comedy act on a TV amateur hour telling jokes about the people in Mayberry. Everyone in town gets upset when they take the jokes seriously.

Title: Big Brother
Summary: Howard volunteers to be a boy's 'Big Brother' but gets distracted by his pretty older sister.

Title: Opie's Most Unforgettable Character
Summary: Andy's feelings are hurt when Opie doesn't pick him as the subject of his high-school paper.

Title: Goober's Contest
Summary: Goober holds a contest at the filling station. An error at the printer's causes one coupon to be worth $200 instead of $10 or less.

Title: Opie's First Love
Summary: Opie's date for Arnold's big birthday party cancels at the last minute to go with a 'cooler' guy.

Title: Howard, the Bowler
Summary: Howard fills in on the bowling team and amazes everyone with his skill.

Title: A Trip to Mexico
Summary: Aunt Bee wins a trip to Mexico and takes Clara and Myrtle. When they get back, they aren't even speaking to each other.

Title: Andy's Trip to Raleigh
Summary: Andy has to break a date with Helen and go to Raleigh to meet with a lawyer who turns out to be a pretty blonde. Andy lies to Helen about it, but she finds out.

Title: Opie Steps Up in Class
Summary: Andy sends Opie to a fancy camp where he makes friends with a rich boy. Later, when they attend a father-son get-together, Andy finds himself acting high-class just like he told Opie not to do.

Title: Howard's Main Event
Summary: Howard finds romance with a new girl in town, Millie Hutchins. However, her former boyfriend Clyde threatens to beat him up if they don't stop dating.

Title: Aunt Bee, the Juror
Summary: Aunt Bee serves jury duty.

Title: The Tape Recorder
Summary: Opie and Arnold record a prisoner telling where the money from a bank robbery is.

Title: Opie's Group
Summary: After Opie joins a rock band he starts to stay out late and gets F's in all of his schoolwork. Aunt Bee has Clara talk to him about the situation.

Title: Aunt Bee and the Lecturer
Summary: Clara has eyes for a visiting professor, but he falls hard for Aunt Bee. She finds out why when he begins to constantly compare her to his late wife.

Title: Andy's Investment
Summary: Andy gets worried about how to pay for Opie's college, so he opens a laundromat to earn some extra money. It takes a lot more of his time that he thought it would.

Title: Howard and Millie
Summary: Howard and Millie decide to get married. On a train trip to Millie's hometown, they discover they might not be as compatible as they had thought.

Title: Aunt Bee's Cousin
Summary: Andy discovers that Aunt Bee's globe-trotting millionaire cousin is actually a hobo and tries to keep the truth from Aunt Bee and everyone else.

Title: Suppose Andy Gets Sick
Summary: Goober takes over at the Sheriff's office while Andy has the flu.

Title: Howard's New Life
Summary: After seeing a travelogue about island life on TV, Howard quits his job to become a beachcomber in the Caribbean.

Title: Goober the Executive
Summary: When Goober hears that Wally has the gas station up for sale, he decides the time has come for him to become a businessman. With Andy and Emmett acting as co-signers, he borrows the money and is soon the proud owner of his own business. His idea of being a business executive may be a bit off kilter however. His first act is to hire an employee to do the manual work while he does all of the 'thinking'. Only problem is, he's not much of businessman and Andy and Emmett start to wonder what they have got themselves into when Goober starts to make some pretty serious ...

Title: The Mayberry Chef
Summary: Aunt Bee hosts a cooking show but Andy and Opie suffer at supper time.

Title: Emmett's Brother-in-Law
Summary: Emmett's wife pressures him into becoming an insurance salesman, like his successful Brother-in-Law.

Title: Opie's Drugstore Job
Summary: Opie gets a job working at the drugstore and learns that everyone makes mistakes.

Title: The Church Benefactors
Summary: A $500 donation to the church causes conflict.

Title: Barney Hosts a Summit Meeting
Summary: When Barney hears about an international summit meeting that will be held in the area, he volunteers the home of a wealthy Mayberry citizen. He fails to get the permission of the homeowner first, and the owner refuses to let them use his house. The summit entourage arrives in town with no place to hold the meeting.

Title: Goober Goes to an Auto Show
Summary: Goober finds out Andy is taking Aunt Bee and Opie to the auto show in Raleigh and asks to go along, confident they'll get free samples when salesmen find out he's a 'big operator'. At the hotel, Goober calls up Roy Swanson, an old friend from trade school, to see how he's doing and to brag a little. They meet at the show and Goober is surprised to find out that Roy is a senior vice-president in charge of engineering with Amalgamated Motors. After hearing about a fellow student, Goober tells Roy he has a chain of stations instead of just one. When Roy meets the Taylors...

Title: Aunt Bee's Big Moment
Summary: Aunt Bee takes flying lessons but doesn't feel she is ready to fly solo.

Title: Helen's Past
Summary: It seems that Helen was once a gangster's moll when she lived in Kansas City.

Title: Emmett's Anniversary
Summary: Emmett wants to buy Martha a mink coat from Flora's friend, who is in the business. When he and Flora go to Mount Pilot to get it, Martha sees them and thinks they are having an affair.

Title: The Wedding
Summary: Howard decides to become a 'swinging bachelor' after his mother gets married and moves to Mount Pilot.

Title: Sam for Town Council
Summary: Sam Jones runs against Emmett for a seat on the Town Council.

Title: Opie and Mike
Summary: Opie helps Mike learn how to deal with a bully at school.

Title: A Girl for Goober
Summary: A new dating service wants to test out its questionnaire that is meant to find people with common interests and pursuits. They focus on Mayberry and soon Goober is filling out the questionnaire. Opie tries to tell him that he's not answering the questionnaire correctly - such as saying he read 30 books a month when in fact he reads that many comic books - but Goober perseveres. Soon, he's on a date with the highly educated designer of the questionnaire and it becomes painfully apparent that they have little in common. As things develop however, she soon finds there ...

Title: Mayberry R.F.D.
Summary: Sam Jones has his friend Mario from Italy come to help out on the farm. Mario brings his father and sister along without telling Sam first. When they have a difficult time adjusting to life in Mayberry, Sam has to decide if they can stay in the U.S.
